ygData.subject: Re: Shadowstep vs. Fade
ygData.msgSnippet: And lets not forget an equally important fact,  shadow step will teleport you far, far away.  For example just last night a Sand Giant was pounding me while I
ygData.messageBody:
And lets not forget an equally important fact, shadow step will teleport
you far, far away. For example just last night a Sand Giant was pounding me
while I was hunting DeepWater crocs, not a pretty sight, anyway I shadow
stepped to the end of the zone in the water which gave me enough time to
gate. The shadow step, gate combo has saved my butt more times than I can
count.

David R. Crowder
Thomcomp, Inc
(610) 834-1120 x341


-----Original Message-----
From: Shadowwalker [SMTP:Shadowwalker@...]
Sent: Sunday, April 18, 1999 6:27 PM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Shadowstep vs. Fade

Shadow Step also only takes 2 seconds to cast rather than the 4
seconds for fade, so you are much more likely to cast it without being
interupted in a melee situation.

-Shadowwalker of Karana

----- Original Message -----
From: Nemesis <mailto:nemesis@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <mailto:eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, April 18, 1999 10:59 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Shadowstep vs. Fade

You get a greater distance with Shadow Step. It has pulled
me out of a jam more than once.

Neme

<mailto:SRAETS@...> >
>
>Can anyone tell me what is better about Shadowstep? From
the
>description it seems very similar to Fade ... so why should
I buy
>Shadowstep?
>
>Aznyin
>Erudite Wizard, level 10
